newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain - Soy firms, Wheat mostly steady.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain - Soy firms, Wheat mostly steady.

text.p: FOB Gulf basis values for most soybean positions firmed on Wednesday while corn and wheat values were mostly steady.
But export demand for U.S. grains continued to be slow.

South Korea said it will tender Sept 5 for 20,000 tonnes of U.S. No. 1 soybean. Bids will be opened Sept 6. Shipment was set for Sept 26-Oct 15 if from the U.S. Gulf or for October 11-30 if from the Pacific Northwest.

Also, U.S. exporters reported sales of 100,000 tonnes of optional origin wheat to Sri Lanka for the 1996/97 marketing year, USDA said Wednesday. The sale comprised 50,000 tonnes hard red winter and 50,000 tonnes soft red winter.
Dealers quoted the following afternoon FOB U.S. Gulf values, basis Chicago futures, except hard red winter wheat basis Kansas City. (In cents per bushel).
No. 3 yellow corn -
September 5-25 - no bid, 43 ov Sept offered
September 11-30 - no bid, 38 ov Sept offered
October 1-20 - no bid, 58 ov Dec offered
October 12-31 - no bid, 50 ov Dec offered
November 1-15 - no bid, 40 ov Dec offered
